Verified Resident
2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 09/14/2017
Park Ridge has been the best apartment community I have experienced. It's quite and I always feel safe. The office staff is friendly. Maintenance is quick and does a good job. They are also always doing things outside to maintain the appearance like painting the hallways or tennis courts. They have regular bug spraying outside and are on top of maintaining he landscape. I have also never seen the trash dumpsters over flowing like at other apartment communities.

Was charged $1200 because they didn't remind me about my lease, but never fail to fill my inbox with useless emails. The doors in the unit didn't don't completely close. My oven and dishwasher wasn't plugged into the wall properly and would literally move around as I was cooking/cleaning. The walls are super thin, so you can hear every neighbor all hours of the night. They now require pool passes to the sad small swimming pool, not to mention the resident parking spots that are always taken by guests, even though the center keeps promising that our parking decals mean something. What a waste of time and money

Report
Verified Resident
2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/12/2017
I just moved in. The only difficulty in the move-in process was finding anything available, at first. I had to do callbacks on my own. Then a place opened up. Had to move three weeks early and pay rent in two places for three weeks. It was that or stay in my terrible apartment for another 3 weeks and have only one moving day. The apartment appears more spacious and is definitely a better location for me. Management, office people and maintenance are all nice and professional. I had a leak in my first week. It was handled quickly. I love the location and grounds that this apartment is located on. Only complaints. Kinda noisy. The location of my apartment leaves much to be desired (first floor, right next to stairwell). Pool is crazy small. There are a lot of tenants here. Can't imagine anyone has room to actually enjoy the pool when the season comes. And parking. You can almost never get a spot anywhere near your place. At least I can't. And visitor spaces are always full ( I imagine by tenants who don't want to park too far in their own spaces or have too many automobiles, because some cars NEVER leave.) Overall. It's a cute spot. I love my fireplace. The bedrooms and living rooms have a good size. Ample storage(everywhere but the kitchen.) Kitchen and bathrooms are a bit cramped. Especially the bathroom. I hit my head on my towel rack standing up from the toilet. I'm only 5'7 Would I move here again? Yes. Just feel a bit overpriced. But. It was better than my prior experience at my last place. So. Good so far.

Report
Resident
2014 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/15/2017
We have loved living in Park Ridge the past few years. The only reason we are moving is that we have more kids and need a 3 bedroom now. If not for that, we would stay. It's so safe and much quieter than you'd expect, being off the main hwy. So so close to everything! 3 grocery stores within 2 minutes, Southpoint is 5 minutes away, great food and coffee within minutes. We would even take the onsite trail (part of Tobacco Trail) through to the back roads to walk to Southpoint. Lovely onsite trails that take you to a playground and outdoor gym. And the pool is very nice and tree lined. Maintenance is here within 24 hours if we ever have an issue. Will be super sad to leave.

Park Ridge is in a nice location right on 54 next to the highway and grocery stores. The new light fixtures, the open layout of my apartment and most importantly the high ceilings on a top floor apartment makes the place very nice to live in. The walls are thin though so expect to hear the goings on of your neighbors and to pay a high electricity bill during the winter. Management and service staff are all amazing and very helpful. Solve most problems quickly and professionally. Would definitely recommend.

Report
Resident
2014 - 2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/01/2016
I've been living here for over 2 years now and I love it! The office staff are always super friendly and maintenance will come within 24 hours of the request. The complex is off of a major road (54), but you don't feel like it since you're backed up from it. There is a water fowl preserve backed up to part of the property and woodcroft is on the other side. We have access to woodcroft's path system and use it regularly. Pets are allowed and noise level hasn't been an issue. There is a laundry room on site, as well as a gym, tennis court, dog park, and pool. Laundry hookups are available in all units, but some of the newer units have a washer and dryer in the unit. Sometimes parking is tricky, but I can always find a spot near my building. The complex always has some kind of event for its residents. The office staff and maintenance is efficient and will email and call you for anything pertaining to your apartment. I love living here and look forward to being here years to come!

Report
Resident
2015 - 2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 08/17/2016
I stumbled upon this apartment complex mistakenly and quickly fell in love with it. PRE is nested between Woodcroft, a family-friendly community in south Durham, as well as a large variety of shopping centers, malls, and the like. The pros of this apartment in my perspective are as followed: great staff (excellent communication), extremely quick maintenance delivery, payments available online and in person, nice pool, decent gym, walking/running/biking trails in the "backyard", beautiful landscaping/outdoor maintenance, tennis courts, a good dog park and dog waste bins around the complex, it feels safe and welcoming, diverse and generally nice residents, has bus stops for those who take public transportation, and is located 25 minutes to downtown Raleigh, 12 minutes to UNC/Franklin Street, and 15 minutes to downtown Durham. The cons of this complex are small in comparison: The dog park is partially dirt leaving you to bathe your dog with each visit, visitor parking is heavily enforced (i.e. towing enforced). I highly recommend this complex to anyone who wants to be comfortable at a reasonable price.
I stumbled upon this apartment complex mistakenly and quickly fell in love with it. PRE is nested between Woodcroft, a family-friendly community in south Durham, as well as a large variety of shopping centers, malls, and the like. The pros of this apartment in my perspective are as followed: great staff (excellent communication), extremely quick maintenance delivery, payments available online and in person, nice pool, decent gym, walking/running/biking trails in the "backyard", beautiful landscaping/outdoor maintenance, tennis courts, a good dog park and dog waste bins around the complex, it feels safe and welcoming, diverse and generally nice residents, has bus stops for those who take public transportation, and is located 25 minutes to downtown Raleigh, 12 minutes to UNC/Franklin Street, and 15 minutes to downtown Durham. The cons of this complex are small in comparison: The dog park is partially dirt leaving you to bathe your dog with each visit, visitor parking is heavily enforced (i.e. towing enforced). All of this was way beyond any call of duty, and I am so very grateful for their kindness and generosity. Thank you so very much. Julia R

Report
Resident
2013 - 2014 Not Recommended Reviewed 05/08/2014
I cant wait to move OUT! Any one of my complaints on their own really wouldn't be a dealbreaker for me- or for most people. But when you add them all together over a year, this place becomes unbearable. Where to start.... When moving in, the former asst manager was less than a delight. Thank goodness she is gone (promoted, by the way). I confirmed in advance that I did not need an appointment to move in, but then she was very taken back by me arriving at the office the morning of my move in date. She said she had not even walked the unit yet and there were no keys made. I had to wait an extra hour with my moving helpers for her to get it all together- no apologizes- she just acted as though I was a huge inconvenience. My biggest issue is NOISE. The breezways are not open on both sides. Therefore, the entrances are concrete caves in which every single sound is amplified. If a neighbor is quietly talking on their phone as they enter their unit, you can hear that anywhere in the apartment. I have been woken several times by drunk neighbors in the middle of the night, laughing and shrieking as they make their way into their units. Also, the mailboxes are on the exterior wall outside of my apartment. The pictures hung on that wall are crooked and one has broken from the carrier and others slammed the mailbox doors too hard. I can literally hear the mail carrier opening/closing the door when I am in the shower- which is on the other side of the apartment. Finally, I am interrupted every time my neighbor uses his patio. The sliding glass door is so loud and stuck that it shakes my ceiling. And he is a smoker, so he is out there about once an hour. My sliding glass door is also nearly impossible to open so I never use the patio. I am on the ground floor, and my view of the parking lot and moss is not that appealing anyways. Speaking of shower- it is GROSS. My bathtub, which is tiny, should have been resealed before move in. The tub is chipped, which causes mold to grow in the shower after about one week. I literally scrub the bathtub three times a week- it still looks disgusting and awful, but there is no mold. I also get very little hot water, but after several maintenance requests to address that, I gave up. I shower quickly because I dont really want to be in there anyways. If you have one of the 650 sp ft units, the closet is absurd. It is a narrow long closet and when it is empty, it is not so bad. But once you put things in there... you can even get to the back. I step in sideways, reach to the back, knocking most things off the hangers. The bedroom is very small so there is not a lot of space for a large dresser instead. The insulation is very poor. For my small apartment, my electric bills were close to $200 a month in the winter. I had a 3 story townhouse before this place and the bills were not even close to that. Except to pay about $40 a month for water and trash. I use about $5 worth of water, but pay the rest in fees. The pool is ok- but by no means can you call it nice. There are usually kids there screaming or crying and their parents do nothing to address the behavior, so it is not peaceful either. The bathrooms are dirty and never have toilet paper so I expect there is a lot of waste that ends up in the pool. Last week there was a bum who appeared to be residing in the dumpster area. A lot of insects get into the place- roaches and spiders mainly. This is NC and I am on the first floor, so I know it happens, but it has happened here much more than other places I have lived. There is no a lot of visitor parking close to all buildings. It looks like some residents have unauthorized people living with them because the visitor spots always have the same few cars in them- all day, every day. The kitchens were recently updated, and they look alright. The lighting fixtures in the kitchen and dining room are modern and nice. the property claimed it had a full renovation, but changing out cabinets and countertops is an update, not a renovation. As part of the 'reno' they painted doors and patios. They painted our front doors shut! I had to body slam myself through the door to get in- I actually thought they had changed the locks on me! The insulation around then door was then stuck to paint and as a result, I have to pull my door with all my strength to be able to lock it up when I leave. This complex is very overpriced considering what it offers. There are plenty of other options within just a few miles that are just a tad more expensive, but miles ahead of Park Ridge. The maintenance team is nice, but there is no sense of urgency to complete requests. I am somewhat embarrassed to have company over because the community just looks rundown and poorly kept. I don't want anyone to have to use my moldy shower, and the amount of noise frightens most guests. Don't waste your money on this place- you will just have to pay to move again in a year!

Report
Resident
2014 Not Recommended Reviewed 04/22/2014
PRG definitely has a profit focused approach to apartment management (rather than a service or customer centered approach). There are several little monthly fees. In total my rent was $680 but I was paying about $755 a month for fees water/sewer/trash. Something must be wrong with the insulation too because the winter heating bills were over $200 for the larger one bedroom. It seems like they are constantly trying to cut corners in small ways to make money. For example when something was wrong with the power meter for the external lights, they cut them off and tried to use touch lights that didn't even light up the ground beneath them. A couple weeks ago the recycling dumpster disappeared. Now they want to raise my rent by 10%, even though they told me two weeks earlier that 4% was normal. Oh and stapled to that letter was a list of all the fees and hassles associated with moving. It screamed that they can't keep customers with the positives of the community and instead have better luck convincing people that it is more of an inconvenience to move. Move in was a bit of a hassle. Somehow the unit that they thought was going to be available on the day I wanted to move in was actually just being vacated that day and they needed 2 weeks to get it ready. When I moved it there were several things that were missing or still needed to be done (missing towel rack for the bathroom, missing window screens, ect) so definitely go over the move in check list very well. Maintenance- Slow. Takes a day or three to get to any requests and it takes about 3x as long as it should take. Literally took 3 hours to install weather stripping on two doors and within 2 months it started to fall off. Oh and check your locks, they tried to just remove the strike plate on my front door and leave about a 2" opening for the deadbolt. Hell I think even I could have jimmied that lock. Pests- There was a roach in the hall closet at move in. It disappeared a couple weeks later, but the closet still smells musty. Haven't seen a roach since. Fleas haven't been a problem. I do see a spider and a house centipede about once a month. Fruit flies almost consistently during the summer. Overall, it's about what I would expect for an apartment building in the south. They're really good about adding you to the pest control list, and the pest guy is very nice, however they only spray door thresholds and windows. Oh and there was a 4 foot black snake on my neighbors door one morning.

2011 - 2014 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/02/2014
I lived at Park Ridge Estates for the last 3 years. I also lived there, several years ago, and I came back because of the great apartment location and community. I only left this time because I purchased a home. I loved my one bedroom top floor apartment. It had cathedral ceilings, was the perfect size and overlooked the wooded area behind the apartments. It was always very quiet, and I enjoyed coming home to that relaxing atmosphere. I also liked that the apartments are pet-friendly. My cats enjoyed watching the birds from the floor-to-ceiling windows. It was a good space for all of us. The management has done a fantastic job with upgrading the property and apartments. It has really transformed since I lived there many years ago, even though I loved it back then, too. There are walking trails behind the apartments, but just walking through the community is nice, with all the pretty landscaping. I also appreciated being able to get free coffee at the leasing office. They have a Keurig machine and are always stocked with different coffee blends, plus a variety of teas. I worked from home often, so being able to pop down for a nice coffee was great. Everyone there has been very friendly and helpful. I appreciate all the updates they've made and the way they keep the community clean and maintained.

Report
Resident
2013 Not Recommended Reviewed 11/22/2013
I've been living here for awhile, and it is one of the worst place I've lived. When I first moved in, right away I noticed how shotty everything was. Huge paint drips running down doors and walls, cheapest bathtub I've used, thin flimsy doors, cupboard doors that broke right away. And my shower leaked into the downstairs neighbors! You can also hear every step the neighbors above you take! I've been in three different apartments (visiting neighbors), and it is the same in all. The hot water also takes a very long time to reach even the nearest sink, and the water (regardless of temperature) is always cloudy. There are cockroaches everywhere in the kitchen, they 'spray' for bugs a few times a year, but it is not effective. Everyday I am killing at least one cockroach in my kitchen. I have two pets and they are both covered in fleas, as is my bedroom. I've never had a problem with fleas before. You pay for water and garbage here. Speaking of garbage, there is no lighting near the big garbage bins, which is surrounded by big bushes and trees. I was very scared the one evening I took the trash out after the sun went down. And the only sidewalks are in front of the buildings and the office. If you walk your dog, you have to walk in the street or the grass. In the weight room, nearly everything is broken and the room smells moldy. I tried to use the restroom once and only one light in the far corner worked, no toilet paper, and there was poop all over the seat. The staff is pretty unhelpful. Several times I've had packages sent to me, which I've needed to collect at the office. It takes 2-3 times for each package before someone will find my package. They always have some flimsy excuse, as if it's not their fault for not finding my package. Why would I have a notice in my mailbox that I have a package, if my package isn't at your office? This is very frustrating and I am worried that my, often expensive, packages will not turn up. The parking lot is often nearly full when I get off work, and the Visitor parking spots are so far from my apartment I don't want visitors. We used to have an enclosed screen porch, but they "repainted" the porches (more dried globs of paint!) and refused to put them back up, claiming "people like putting their plants out." I suspect they merely didn't want to pay more money to put screens back up. The porch is now useless to me as now I cannot open the sliding door without more bugs coming into my home, and I cannot supervise my pets. Now if you look through the complex, nearly no one has anything on their porches. Also, sunlight does not come into my apartment, at all. At 3pm, even in the summer, I must turn lights on to see. My pets are miserable not having sunny spots to lay in, and several of my plants died (oh yeah, the porch doesn't get much sunlight either). And in the master bedroom, a window popped off track so maintence came to fix it. It now cannot be opened. As for AC/Heating, it only cools/heats the few rooms by the heater, and barely touches the master bedroom and it's bathroom. And finally, from what I understand, the owners of this complex are not residents of North Carolina.

Pretty sure corrosion is corrosion whether it is here or on the moon), A/C has broken 2 times (after I informed them that the thermostat wasn't reading correctly), mold in the bathroom (visible and in large quantities at move in), metal strips in between living room and bathroom not installed properly (cut my foot on this and it required multiple service calls to fix), the pipes were not connected to the sinks (drained into the cabinets for the 1st day until I fixed them), door to laundry room was half attached to the hinges until I fixed it, air filter installed wrong, door to patio they WILL NOT install weather stripping even though I can put my hand underneath it (I was told that if you completely seal a door properly it won't open --by the property manager), lights not installed for move in, and the dryer vent needed fixed at move in (when their maintenance staff came in to fix it, they destroyed the flooring and are currently blaming it on me). Verified Manager09/05/2013

We appreciate your review and do apologize that you have had a difficult move in experience here. While Park Ridge is undergoing many extensive interior and exterior renovations, minor repairs may still be necessary in each apartment renovated and non-renovated. We strive to have any interior or exterior repair noted in a work order so that our staff can ensure that all repairs are made by a maintenance team member or a contractor if needed. As a courtesy, we do offer some of our residents to have a reserved parking space due to a handicap which is verified via documentation. These residents are required to have a parking permit like every other resident. In the event of a resident disturbance, upon notification, it is our duty to ensure the well-being of our residents. Regardless of where a person chooses to live, unexpected events may occur. If you would like to set up an appointment to meet with the property manager, please feel free to contact the office. We really hope that your continued stay at Park Ridge can be a pleasant experience and we appreciate your feedback.

Verified Manager07/26/2012

We strive to keep our valued tenants and guests as comfortable as possible. To relieve safety concerns, we currently employ a State Trooper as our community's courtesy officer. He lives on-site and keeps an eye and ear out for us when we cannot. He is more than willing to assist any residents with questions or concerns. As you can appreciate, no one can guarantee your safety and there are important safety guidelines you can follow to maintain your personal security while at home and away. Our professional leasing and management staff is here to assist you as much as possible and we would like to address any other concerns you may have. Our experienced, on-site maintenance staff strives to complete work orders within 48 hours of receipt. Please let us know immediately if you experience any continued maintenance issues so we can work to correct them for you. Thank you.

Thank you for your feedback. In an effort to update the community we have recently made some changes. We listened to the wants of our residents and the outside community and no longer offer bulk utilities, allowing residents the freedom to choose services such as cable and internet based on their own needs. We adjusted those fees accordingly. There are many street lights located throughout the parking lots as well as outside building lights and interior breezeway lights. This is all in an effort to keep the community brightly lit 24 hours a day. If you ever see a light that is dimming or out, please let the office know immediately. We strive to complete work orders within 48 hours of notification. If there are any outstanding issues in your apartment please let us know so we may address the issue. As always, if you ever have any questions or concerns please do not hesitate to contact us. Thank you for choosing our community.

Resident
2011 - 2012 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/25/2012
Ive lived here for almost a year now, and can't wait to renew my lease. Apartment hunting in this area was not a fun trip for me. Several places wanted me to sign a lease before I saw any of the apartments itself, and I even put in a deposit for another apartment and set a move in date with them before the current tenant said they decided not to leave and I was told "too bad." When I stumbled upon Park Ridge Estates, I was pleasantly surprised! The people in the office were so helpful and professional. In other offices I felt like I didnt get much help or respect because I am young, but Park Ridge was a different story. The buildings are older (built in the mid 80s i think I was told?)and some of my appliances are older as well, but it has been a wonderful experience to live here! I can submit work orders with ease on the website, and each one I submitted received a response the very next day. I once had a leak by the window after a big storm, and the workmen fixed it the next day, sealed it, and after several bad storms, have never had a problem since. To my fortune, I have never seen mice or roaches or anything of the sort since I've lived here. The landscaping is also beautiful! The drive through the front entrance is pleasant, and the grounds are well kept. It's a friendly neighborhood and I always feel safe. The parking lots are well lit, so I feel safe walking to my car or taking out the trash. The pool area is also very nice, and recently redone if I recall correctly. Grills nearby the pool are a plus as well! If you choose to live at Park Ridge Estates, I hope you have as much of a pleasant experience as I have! I am so happy to call this place my home and love the convenience of being near so many restaurants and shopping centers.

ANYWAY, I've been living at Park Ridge for almost a year now and so far I've had no problems. They DO RUN BACKGROUND CHECKS!! and I've never felt like my home here was unsafe. The interiors are a little bit old but I think it's a great deal compared to what you'd pay at a newer complex in the area. I'm hardly ever in the office but the staff was very helpful during my move. Parking can be tight at times, but I love my screened in porch and fireplace. The location is great - so close to grocery stores, Hwy 40, and Southpoint Mall. I took the time to post this because I really like where I live. I plan on renewing my lease. Be a nice neighbor, pay your rent (like an adult!), and take care of your apartment and you'll love living here.

Resident
2006 - 2011 Recommended Property Reviewed 09/14/2011
I've been at Park Ridge since 2006. From the first day the staff was friendly and supportive - the manager even stayed late because I got lost on the way to Durham. A few years later, when I required an emergency move, they moved me the very next day, and did everything possible to make the transition smooth and worry-free. The surroundings couldn't be better if you're a nature lover. The trails are there for long walks, and the woods around the complex have beautiful birds, deer, and other wildlife. (One of my favorites is the bunny who comes by every day.) Neighbors are friendly, the complex is safe, and the pool is a wonderful asset in the summer. Shopping is easy and local: it's only a mile in either direction to a supermarket, and there's a mall about two miles away. The screen porches are another great feature - even though you are in an apartment, you have outdoor space.
I've been at Park Ridge since 2006. From the first day the staff was friendly and supportive - the manager even stayed late because I got lost on the way to Durham. A few years later, when I required an emergency move, they moved me the very next day, and did everything possible to make the transition smooth and worry-free. 2007 - 2009 Recommended Property Reviewed 01/11/2009
People need to keep in mind here that you should not just look at the really bad reviews nor should you look at the really good reviews, look at the mid range. Because the good reviews could possibly be staff members and the bad reviews could be disgruntled residents that were probably evicted because they couldn't pay rent. One thing I'm sure everyone can agree on is Park Ridge really does have a good location, right by I 40 and Southpoint, it's definitely convenient. I've lived here for 2 yrs and yeah i've had a few maintenance problems but honestly it's to be expected when you move into an older community. I guess I would just recommend to everyone to have realistic expectations. As far as those people who have complained about noise... really? That's going to happen in any apartment complex, sometimes we just have noisy neighbors. It's just something really hard to control sometimes. Management has the right to kick people out if lets say they're having tons of crazy loud parties, but if there is a dog barking etc... they don't have much power to control what residents are doing. I have heard of a few mold issues but from talking to my neighbors about it, it has been handled well...as soon as mold was reported Park Ridge contacted the city of Durham to come out and inspect their apartment to see what needed to be done. The city of Durham came up with a list and Park Ridge complied...there hasn't been a problem since.

puhlease1 01/11/2009

I have lived in Park Ridge for about six months now, and I agree with the review - it's an older complex, with older complex issues. There are kids (college) who seem to be running the place, and they can do a below adequate job sometimes), but yes, it's a great location, and feels like you're living in the woods. I've had issues with my refrigerator leaking - started with about once every two weeks, I'd find a puddle on my floor, call for maintenance, they'd be here the next day to flush out whatever it is they flush out, and it would be good for awhile, then burp out more water. It has been several times, and now I'm calling them to replace it, as it is getting worse now. We'll see what happens. I'm lucky, in that I'm in a building with people who seem to be relatively quiet. I'm on the second floor. And, when I have a gathering in my place, the lady downstairs doesn't appear to hear much, though I'm careful to ask her to let me know if she does. All in all, while it might not be the best place in the world, it's relatively cheap, the apartment space is good, and it's in a good location. I don't think I'd want to live in on of the "garden" (i.e., basement) apartments though. I'm betting they get a bit damp.

Resident
2008 Recommended Property Reviewed 09/04/2008
When I read the reviews here, I had to think hard about renting here. However, the location and the price just couldn't be ignored, and I moved in July 2008. I've been here a little over a month, and plan on providing updates here as I can. In the meantime, I've actually had good experiences here. I live in a 2nd floor one bedroom, and I love it. Yes, the carpet is a few years old, but it was cleaned when I moved in, and the spots that came back through after drying were taken care of with some Resolve. The location is amazing, right off 54 across the highway from Southpoint Mall. I have a nice Food Lion (nicest one I've ever seen) and a Harris Teeter 1/2 mile to the right, and a Kroger and another Harris Teeter 3/4 mile to the left. It's edging the nice area of Woodcroft, and that's a big plus. It's away from the bus line, so I've never seen anyone panhandling or being shifty, which is a big plus from where I lived before. I have had a couple general maintenance issues since I've moved in, but nothing serious. And, each time I told the office staff I had an issue, it was less than 48 hours later it was fixed. My kitchen sink garbage disposal was clogged and not working, and it was fixed while I was at work the next day. My refrigerator leaked, and again, there was a work order on my counter the next day. Big thanks to -----, who seems to be the person signing the work orders. :) When my washer/dryer were delivered late in the afternoon, maintenance left me a note asking me not to use the washer that day because a valve leaked. It was fixed and hooked up by the next afternoon. Parking can be a hassle, especially when idiots park in no parking zones. I do wish property management would follow through on threats to tow. Otherwise, it's not any worse than any other apartment complex. Is my apartment perfect? No, of course not - if it were, I'd be paying $900 a month for it. I did get a deal on my apartment by a happy accident, and most apartments in my range are $709.00, but I think that's a deal, too. But the layout is great, the walk in closet is humongous, and it being right on walking trials all over Woodcroft, as well as having a really well-equipped fitness room and nice pool makes it well worth it. What I REALLY like is the layout. Whoever initially built these places thought about the quality of living where sound is concerned. Adjoining walls on the same floor are kitchen, bathrooms, and closets, so bedrooms and living rooms are not sharing a wall. I don't hear downstairs neighbors, and while I have neighbors across the hall that have a somewhat barky dog, I only hear it when I'm in the hall, not when I'm in my apartment. Halls are open and well lit with sunlights in the roof, but tacky looking with popcorn celings peeling away and bugs. Feels a bit like summer camp at times LOL. For the other negatives: Yep - college students seem to be the norm in office staff, and turnover seems high, but they've all been friendly and willing to help out if there is an issue, and were willing to ask someone if they could not answer my questions. I don't think the dumpsters are emptied enough, and they need to have more recycling bins because they're always overflowing so when it rains, plastic bottles are floating down the hill. To me though, these are issues that should be fixed, but are not dealbreakers. By the way, no, I'm not a staff member or someone they're paying to write this. I'm a real live renter with no stake in anything, so get a life and don't flame me. I'm stating my experiences here. My apartment is roomy, the air conditioning works great, it's quiet, and I hope they don't jack my rent way up next year because I plan to stick around.
When I read the reviews here, I had to think hard about renting here. However, the location and the price just couldn't be ignored, and I moved in July 2008. I've been here a little over a month, and plan on providing updates here as I can. In the meantime, I've actually had good experiences here. I live in a 2nd floor one bedroom, and I love it. Yes, the carpet is a few years old, but it was cleaned when I moved in, and the spots that came back through after drying were taken care of with some Resolve. The location is amazing, right off 54 across the highway from Southpoint Mall. I have a nice Food Lion (nicest one I've ever seen) and a Harris Teeter 1/2 mile to the right, and a Kroger and another Harris Teeter 3/4 mile to the left. It's edging the nice area of Woodcroft, and that's a big plus. It's away from the bus line, so I've never seen anyone panhandling or being shifty, which is a big plus from where I lived before. I have had a couple general maintenance issues since I've moved in, but nothing serious. And, each time I told the office staff I had an issue, it was less than 48 hours later it was fixed. My kitchen sink garbage disposal was clogged and not working, and it was fixed while I was at work the next day. My refrigerator leaked, and again, there was a work order on my counter the next day. Big thanks to -----, who seems to be the person signing the work orders. :) When my washer/dryer were delivered late in the afternoon, maintenance left me a note asking me not to use the washer that day because a valve leaked. It was fixed and hooked up by the next afternoon. Parking can be a hassle, especially when idiots park in no parking zones. I do wish property management would follow through on threats to tow. Otherwise, it's not any worse than any other apartment complex. Is my apartment perfect? No, of course not - if it were, I'd be paying $900 a month for it. I did get a deal on my apartment by a happy accident, and most apartments in my range are $709.00, but I think that's a deal, too. But the layout is great, the walk in closet is humongous, and it being right on walking trials all over Woodcroft, as well as having a really well-equipped fitness room and nice pool makes it well worth it. What I REALLY like is the layout. Whoever initially built these places thought about the quality of living where sound is concerned. Adjoining walls on the same floor are kitchen, bathrooms, and closets, so bedrooms and living rooms are not sharing a wall. I don't hear downstairs neighbors, and while I have neighbors across the hall that have a somewhat barky dog, I only hear it when I'm in the hall, not when I'm in my apartment. Halls are open and well lit with sunlights in the roof, but tacky looking with popcorn celings peeling away and bugs. Feels a bit like summer camp at times LOL. For the other negatives: Yep - college students seem to be the norm in office staff, and turnover seems high, but they've all been friendly and willing to help out if there is an issue, and were willing to ask someone if they could not answer my questions. I don't think the dumpsters are emptied enough, and they need to have more recycling bins because they're always overflowing so when it rains, plastic bottles are floating down the hill. To me though, these are issues that should be fixed, but are not dealbreakers. By the way, no, I'm not a staff member or someone they're paying to write this. I'm a real live renter with no stake in anything, so get a life and don't flame me. I'm stating my experiences here. My apartment is roomy, the air conditioning works great, it's quiet, and I hope they don't jack my rent way up next year because I plan to stick around. Read less

Resident
2007 - 2008 Not Recommended Reviewed 07/27/2008
We have been at Park Ridge since June 2007. We loved the location and the price. Things were off to a bad start immediately. The apartment wasn't ready on time. Maintenance said that the last renters of our unit turned off the power, so it took time for them to get it back on so that they could perform the required work. Maintenance said that they had just cleaned the carpet, but would be dry in an hour. We waited an hour, but the carpet was still soaking wet. And I am not exaggerating. We had to move our things onto wet carpet, because we had to return the U-haul in the morning, and our friend who was helping us move had to leave in a couple of hours. When the carpet did finally dry after a couple of days, it was crusty-feeling. Even with the doors and windows open it took a long time -- there just wasn't much air circulation in the apartment. There are no ceiling fans, and we did not own any at the time. The carpet looked old at move-in and was tearing away from the metal strips that separate carpet from linoleum at the kitchen and bathrooms. A few months ago, I handed my money orders for rent to the Property Manager. I think it was 3 days later, we got a late rent notice on our door. I called and told one of the staff that I handed my rent to the Property Manager a few days ago. She said that the payment wasn't in the usual place and would have to wait until Monday when the Property Manager returns to the office. They did find it, but it was very unnerving for me and very unprofessional of the Property Manager. Since then, we ask for a receipt every month. Parking wasn't a problem when we moved in, but it seems that the complex is closer to full capacity now. At our building and at the one across from us at least, people park behind others (I am assuming those people know each other, or it would be a more serious problem) and along the curb (which is supposedly grounds for towing, but have not seen towing yet). I know of at least 2 cars that have not moved since we moved in a year ago. They are probably disabled for one reason or another. Rent has increased $35 after that first year. At this rate, I am confident we can find a nicer, higher quality construction, and energy efficient apartment. We renewed our lease because we were in the middle of wedding plans instead of researching apartments. We will definitely leave Park Ridge Estates after our current lease expires.

2005 - 2008 Not Recommended Reviewed 05/01/2008
Hello my name is Monica Jenkins and I have real concerns of mold in my apartment. I just met with Jeremy Devlin (prop. manager),maintenance personnel (I think Larry) and Khalid Hawthorne (Housing Inspector-City of Durham)to investigate my apartment 5/1/08 at 11AM. During the inspection, I mentioned that I had seen numerous accounts of mold documented on this site "apartment ratings" (past and present). Jeremy advised that these claims were not credible and simply people wanting to blast his complex. I strongly disagree. The inspector advised that if I could find any of those tenants that have complaints/issues of mold he would be more than happy to investigate further. I was so happy to hear that someone was taking this serious. Jeremy laughed at me when I told him I would try to reach out to everyone that had reported mold. He said, "if you have that much time to waste, go ahead". I don't have time to waste, but my son's health is the reason I am even taking a stand. My situation is almost settled as I am looking to move. But, for the sake of new tenants please speak up as its clear Jeremy won't unless it's exposed. He's always told me he had no knowledge of mold. However, while the inspector recounted situations Jeremy suddenly had a vast knowledge of them and expressed them in great detail. I was hurt. Jeremy is adamant that the mold in my apartment is due to my lack of general house cleaning and negligence. Is this the case for every resident that has mold in their apartment? If there is a person that keeps an immaculate apartment and has mold the inspector needs to document this. If my case is isolated fine...however if Park Ridge is an unsafe place to live due to mold, it needs to be duly noted to the public. You may reach the city of Durham housing inspector Khalid Hawthorne at 919-560-4570 ext. 252 and/or email Khalid.Hawthrone@durhamnc.gov.

I lived in both the 1 and 2 bedroom apartments at Park Ridge. I have had nothing but problems with the property and management. Positives: Location, Location, Location...thats about it. Negatives: Loud neighbors. I went to management at least 10 times while living here. The walls are paper thin and you can hear everything people do, and I mean everything! People let pets stay on the porches and they use the bathroom on them, thus running down onto your patio as well. They have a severe mold problem as well, I am surprised that the health department has not shut them down. The maintenance crew changes so often you have no idea who is coming to fix anything, and they don't know what they are doing. They charge way to much for what you are getting. Yeah they have cable & water included but I really don't see what makes this place so special. The only reason I stayed so long was because it was right around the corner from my job and I did enjoy the Southpoint/Woodcroft location.

I moved to Park Ridge Estates almost 1 year ago. I was attracted to the abundance of trees and the awesome trails that surrounded the complex. Another plus was its close proximity to my job. The staff seemed nice and very attentive... that was until I signed the lease. Recently I placed a service request with management and it took 3 weeks for maintance to respond. When maintenance did come, they did not fix the problem. Finally, out of frustration, I paid $78 to have someone fix a problem that Park Ridge Estates was responsible for fixing. Currently I have called maintenance 3 times within the past 2 weeks to fix my air conditioner, which will not cool below 80 degrees. When I went to speak with management I was told that I had to understand that it was hot outside and considering I had high ceilings I should not expect the a.c. to cool below a certain temperature. I do not know about you, but when the heat index is 100 plus, I would like my dwelling space to be below 80 degrees. Aside from bad maintenance, management is awful, they are never in the office, nor will they return phone calls. The breezeways not kept clean and the prices are too high for what you get. Please do not be fooled by the advertised amenities i.e. weight room and free cable. The weight room, which was supposedly renovated, is nothing more than a small dingy area in the back of the complex that is not safe for anyone after dark. Cable, though it is cheap, is included in your rent. It is not free, as I was told before signing my lease. Needless to say, I would not recommend this property to anyone......unless you do not care about your living area and you have money to waste.<br><br><br>

2005 - 2006 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/05/2006
I lived at Park Ridge for eleven months and I too must say that my time there was not bad at all. The maintanence people are prompt, I had ants at one point, but one visit from the exterminator fixed that. Any problems that I had (i.e. leaking sink) was fixed although it take him two or three times to fix the entire problem. My only real complaint is that I did not like the fact that you could not opt not to have cable which made the rent higher than what I wanted to pay. The reason I moved was because I felt that I could find something cheaper. Also, the people that stayed above me would fight all the time and that made my last few months HELL!!! But the neighborhood itself is very quiet. It was well lit for the most part. Also, I feel that they don't keep the trees cut down enough because the limbs would always be in the parking lot. The washer/dryer room door would come off the hinges alot (very cheap) and all they kept telling me the entire time was the piece was on backorder, but the maintenance guy did the best he could with what he was given.

Wow, after reading all the terrible reviews I am just blown away. I have lived here for 2 years and I am very happy with my apartment. I am a school teacher, very respected in the community, quiet and I have a young daughter. I know that there have been one or two cars broken into, but that is going to be at any apartment community. Whomever said maintenance was the best must work for the place. Yes it does have a new name but it´s the same dump. IT SUCKED! The place is full of mold and mildew. As for maintenance, forget it. Shoddy workmanship performed by underqualified staff. My place flooded the fourth day after I moved in. All apartments have Qwest piping which was NEVER replaced after the huge lawsuit. They pocketed the money. Their idea of fixing a plumbing leak is to let the place dry for a few days then try to cover it up with paint. Lighting is poor and the crime rate is outrageous. One girl was raped in her apartment after the attacker kicked his way through the door. My car was broken into one month after I moved in and in spite of the fact that three Durham cops live on site, no one felt safe after sun down. Management spent money dressing the outside of the place up with fancy landscaping but did not spend a dime on the interior of the apartments. Most of the buildings are sinking into the ground and the doors don´t shut properly. All the ´ground level´ apartments have mold everywhere. You can smell it! The walls have no insulation so even the quietest neighbors comments are heard in the next apartment. The pool is a cesspool of germs and bacteria unfit for humans to be in. Don´t even bother living here listening to their specials. You can get a better place within a few miles with much better living conditions and that doesn´t accept Section 8. <br>Last thing is, if you have pets, they charge an outrageous pet deposit and pet rent.
